issue.title: do full upstream doc generation [skip ci]
issue.body:
Fixes #1064.

Will not switch to Ready for Review before @xvzcf looked at the logic changes and @bhess confirmed the contents changes (dropping an author and build opts in Dilithium doesn't seem OK to just leave it to a script to decide). If the changes as per this PR are legit, we may need to re-release 0.7.0.

After possible changes, old `update_pqclean_alg_docs.py ` will be deleted and the new script will be added to `copy_from_upstream.py` before merge.

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

comment.body: @bhess Please check the latest file contents: This code now merges 'required_flags' from Common_META (if present) into the OQS doc-YML master files.

issue.title: undefined references to `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_keypair`
issue.body:
I am compiling the liboqs using the waf/wscript building system for the `ave32-gcc` compiler.
Now I encounter the following errors during linking:

```
[218/220] Linking build/nanomind.elf
lib/liboqs/src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem640shake.c.2.o: In function `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_new':
/home/simon/workspace/OBC-devboard-1.2.1/build/../lib/liboqs/src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem640shake.c:9: undefined reference to `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_keypair'
/home/simon/workspace/OBC-devboard-1.2.1/build/../lib/liboqs/src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem640shake.c:9: undefined reference to `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_encaps'
/home/simon/workspace/OBC-devboard-1.2.1/build/../lib/liboqs/src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem640shake.c:9: undefined reference to `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_decaps'
```

I tried to search for the source file of the definition but I cannot find the implementation of these 3 funcitons.
A [search in the github repo](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/search?q=OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps) also only shows the 3 results.

```bash
> pwd
/home/simon/workspace/liboqs
> grep -rn . -e 'OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps'
./src/kem/frodokem/external/frodo976aes_params.h:29:#define crypto_kem_enc                OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps
./src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem.h:37:OQS_API OQS_STATUS OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps(uint8_t *ciphertext, uint8_t *shared_secret, const uint8_t *public_key);
./src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem976aes.c:27:	kem->encaps = OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps;
Binary file ./build/lib/liboqs.a matches
./build/include/oqs/kem_frodokem.h:37:OQS_API OQS_STATUS OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps(uint8_t *ciphertext, uint8_t *shared_secret, const uint8_t *public_key);
Binary file ./build/src/kem/frodokem/CMakeFiles/frodokem.dir/kem_frodokem976aes.c.o matches
Binary file ./build/src/kem/frodokem/CMakeFiles/frodokem.dir/external/frodo976aes.c.o matches
Binary file ./build/tests/test_kem_mem matches
Binary file ./build/tests/kat_kem matches
Binary file ./build/tests/test_kem matches
Binary file ./build/tests/speed_kem matches
Binary file ./build/tests/example_kem matches
```

Where are those functions implemented?
The binary files in the build directory are of no use to me since I use a different compiler.

comment.body:
> 
> I know that some code in liboqs does use alignment-related features (e.g., `aligned_alloc`) 

Yes, I already had trouble with the alignment features.
Simply replacing it with `malloc` did the trick of compiling without errors. However, I have not debugged this on actual hardware yet. I fear that I require deep knowledge of the algorithms usage of the target instruction set in order to decide if I can just replace it with `malloc`. 

Anyhow, I was just able to compile a minimal static library using kyber:
`cmake -GNinja -DCMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE=../.CMake/toolchain_avr32.cmake -DOQS_DIST_BUILD=ON -DOQS_USE_OPENSSL=OFF -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -DOQS_BUILD_ONLY_LIB=ON -DOQS_MINIMAL_BUILD="OQS_ENABLE_KEM_kyber_512" ..`

Doing the same thing with `OQS_ENABLE_KEM_sike_p751` yields many pointer conversion warnings
```
../src/kem/sike/external/P751/../ec_isogeny.c:16: warning: passing argument 1 of 'fp2sqr751_mont' from incompatible pointer type
../src/kem/sike/external/P751/../fpx.c:256: note: expected 'const digit_t (*)[24]' but argument is of type 'digit_t (*)[24]'
```

issue.title: do full upstream doc generation [skip ci]
issue.body:
Fixes #1064.

Will not switch to Ready for Review before @xvzcf looked at the logic changes and @bhess confirmed the contents changes (dropping an author and build opts in Dilithium doesn't seem OK to just leave it to a script to decide). If the changes as per this PR are legit, we may need to re-release 0.7.0.

After possible changes, old `update_pqclean_alg_docs.py ` will be deleted and the new script will be added to `copy_from_upstream.py` before merge.

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

comment.body:
> @bhess Please check the latest file contents: This code now merges 'required_flags' from Common_META (if present) into the OQS doc-YML master files.

Thank you for the update! The changes the script made look good to me (except the removed Dilthium author, which will be added to upstream with https://github.com/pq-crystals/dilithium/pull/50).
It's nice that it also catches the dependency flags for Kyber(-90s).

issue.body:

Will not switch to Ready for Review before @xvzcf looked at the logic changes and @bhess confirmed the contents changes (dropping an author and build opts in Dilithium doesn't seem OK to just leave it to a script to decide). If the changes as per this PR are legit, we may need to re-release 0.7.0.

comment.body: Thanks for the re-confirmation that this is logically sound. Regarding contents, well, this is then up to the upstream to put it right. I'll then finalize the PR by integrating it into copy_from_upstream.

issue.title: Cross-compiling for `avr32-gcc`
issue.body:
I am compiling the liboqs using the waf/wscript building system for the `ave32-gcc` compiler.
Now I encounter the following errors during linking:

```
[218/220] Linking build/nanomind.elf
lib/liboqs/src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem640shake.c.2.o: In function `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_new':
/home/simon/workspace/OBC-devboard-1.2.1/build/../lib/liboqs/src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem640shake.c:9: undefined reference to `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_keypair'
/home/simon/workspace/OBC-devboard-1.2.1/build/../lib/liboqs/src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem640shake.c:9: undefined reference to `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_encaps'
/home/simon/workspace/OBC-devboard-1.2.1/build/../lib/liboqs/src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem640shake.c:9: undefined reference to `OQS_KEM_frodokem_640_shake_decaps'
```

I tried to search for the source file of the definition but I cannot find the implementation of these 3 funcitons.
A [search in the github repo](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/search?q=OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps) also only shows the 3 results.

```bash
> pwd
/home/simon/workspace/liboqs
> grep -rn . -e 'OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps'
./src/kem/frodokem/external/frodo976aes_params.h:29:#define crypto_kem_enc                OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps
./src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem.h:37:OQS_API OQS_STATUS OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps(uint8_t *ciphertext, uint8_t *shared_secret, const uint8_t *public_key);
./src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem976aes.c:27:	kem->encaps = OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps;
Binary file ./build/lib/liboqs.a matches
./build/include/oqs/kem_frodokem.h:37:OQS_API OQS_STATUS OQS_KEM_frodokem_976_aes_encaps(uint8_t *ciphertext, uint8_t *shared_secret, const uint8_t *public_key);
Binary file ./build/src/kem/frodokem/CMakeFiles/frodokem.dir/kem_frodokem976aes.c.o matches
Binary file ./build/src/kem/frodokem/CMakeFiles/frodokem.dir/external/frodo976aes.c.o matches
Binary file ./build/tests/test_kem_mem matches
Binary file ./build/tests/kat_kem matches
Binary file ./build/tests/test_kem matches
Binary file ./build/tests/speed_kem matches
Binary file ./build/tests/example_kem matches
```

Where are those functions implemented?
The binary files in the build directory are of no use to me since I use a different compiler.

comment.body: Ultimately we decided not to build the full liboqs project for our avr32 target and just use kyber-512 from the [pq-crystals/kyber](https://github.com/pq-crystals/kyber) project, which compiles right away for `avr32-gcc`.

issue.title: do full upstream doc generation [skip ci]
issue.body:
Fixes #1064.

Will not switch to Ready for Review before @xvzcf looked at the logic changes and @bhess confirmed the contents changes (dropping an author and build opts in Dilithium doesn't seem OK to just leave it to a script to decide). If the changes as per this PR are legit, we may need to re-release 0.7.0.

After possible changes, old `update_pqclean_alg_docs.py ` will be deleted and the new script will be added to `copy_from_upstream.py` before merge.

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

comment.body: This PR now integrates _all_ upstream META information into the `liboqs` doc YAML files (when running `python3 copy_from_upstream.py copy`. As per the above, upstream dilithium has an error in the authors list which currently (thus) is replicated into `liboqs` documentation. @bhess, please do another PR to correct this as and when https://github.com/pq-crystals/dilithium/pull/50 merges. It would have been nice to include this in `liboqs 0.7.0` but I wouldn't hold our release for this.

issue.title: Cross-compiling for `avr32-gcc`

comment.body: Thanks for letting us know. Please also let us know if/when you see a need for other algorithms on that platform.

issue.title: do full upstream doc generation [skip ci]
issue.body:
Fixes #1064.

Will not switch to Ready for Review before @xvzcf looked at the logic changes and @bhess confirmed the contents changes (dropping an author and build opts in Dilithium doesn't seem OK to just leave it to a script to decide). If the changes as per this PR are legit, we may need to re-release 0.7.0.

After possible changes, old `update_pqclean_alg_docs.py ` will be deleted and the new script will be added to `copy_from_upstream.py` before merge.

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

comment.body: Let's hold this until after 0.7.0 release, I'm hoping that rc4 is the last release candidate.
